title: Live Music @ Sagebrush Round-Up
location: Sagebrush Round Up\, 2580 Bunner Ridge Rd.\, Fairmont\, WV\, 26554\, United States
description:
Sagebrush Round-Up hosts a weekly country music show and houses the Country Music Hall of Fame for West Virginia. 
Come early and try a home-cooked dinner. Be sure to snap a selfie in front of our large acoustic guitar! 
Doors open at 4 pm; dinners available at 5 pm; music begins at 6 pm 
Sagebrush Round-Up – located on Bunner Ridge near Fairmont – just six miles east of I-79\, is a tobacco and alcohol-free facility 
$8 / adult; $3 / 6 – 12

title: Upick Lavender
location: Stone House Lavender\, 227 Lanham Lane\, Fairmont\, WV\, 26554\, United States
description:
Feel the lavender haze creepin’ up on us! Go to Stone House Lavender to pick your own bundles\, have a picnic and enjoy the lavender. Opening day is Sunday\, June 8. Sunday from 12-5 p.m. Upick cost is $5 per person and $5 per bundle. 
Season days/times: 
12-5 p.m. Sundays 
5-7 p.m. Tuesday and Thursdays

title: Mannington District Fair
location: Mannington Fair Grounds\, Mannington\, WV 26582\, USA\, Mannington\, United States
description:
The Mannington Fair will take place August 4-9 with events happening at every hour of each day! Here’s a sneak peek of opening day… 
MONDAY\, AUGUST 4\, 2025
(rides will not be open) 

4:00 – 10:00   Bar C Ranch Petting Zoo – Upper Barn
5:00  Enduro Race Registration
6:00  Grand Parade\, Downtown. For Information Contact Kristy Moore\, Parade Marshal – 304-612-0319
7:30   Invocation\, Pledge of Allegiance and Opening of the 2025 Mannington District Fair. Introduction Of Queen Candidates\, visiting Queens\, Baby Photogenic Winners and other guests
8:00   Little Miss Mannington District Fair Queen\, Pre-Teen Competition and Crowning\, and Tiny Miss
8:00   Practice Riding – Horse Show Arena
8:30  Enduro Race 4 & 6 Cylinder (The Miller Hardware 500)
12:00  Closing Time

Find the entire schedule at https://www.manningtondistrictfair.org/schedule.html

title: Yoga at Valley Falls
location: Valley Falls State Park\, Valley Falls State Park\, 720 Valley Falls Rd\, Fairmont\, WV 26554\, USA\, Fairmont\, United States
description:
Connect with your breath\, move your body\, and soak in nature’s beauty at a free weekly yoga series at Valley Falls State Park at 6 p.m. Monday evenings. All are welcome to join for a gentle yoga and meditation flow suitable for all levels\, even beginners. Enjoy the sounds of the falls and relax in the beauty of nature! This event is organized by Community Captain Jess Bryzek through Active Southern WV\, a non-profit dedicated to helping West Virginians become more active by offering free exercise programs. 

Please bring your own yoga mat and water bottle each week. There are mats to borrow if needed. Consider bringing a tarp to place between your mat and the ground to protect your mat. 



If you are brand new to Yoga at Valley Falls\, you MUST complete the waiver form before attending: https://activeswv.org/membership-sign-up/

title: Fairmont Farmers Market
location: Palatine Park\, Palatine Park\, Everest Dr\, Fairmont\, WV 26554\, USA\, Fairmont\, United States

title: Colonial Kids Day
location: Prickett’s Fort State Park
description:
Kids learn through play\, so let them learn about colonial times through play! Colonial Kids Days will be 10:30 am to 3 pm Wednesdays. One of the Fort’s most popular programs\, this day focuses on 18th century life through a child’s eyes.  Bring the kids to the fort to experience a full day of fun and educational activities. Activities will include daily chores in the fort\, life in the militia\, colonial children’s games and a craft in the Visitor Center. Child must be accompanied by an adult and regular admission applies. 
  
Admission: $8 adults\, $6 seniors (60 and up)\, $4 children 6-12\, 5 and under free 
Pricketts Fort Memorial Foundation Members receive free admission and a 10% discount on classes and workshops.

title: Telephone Museum Tour
location: Telephone Museum\, 214 Monroe St.\, Fairmont\, 26554\, United States
description: Take a step or two back in time to understand the intricacy of communication’s past. The museum contains various switchboards\, pay phones\, booths\, test boards as well as other telephone equipment. Tours are led by knowledgeable people who worked in the industry. Can’t make it on a Thursday? Schedule an appointment by calling 304-276-5445.

title: U-pick Lavender
location: Stone House Lavender\, 227 Lanham Lane\, Fairmont\, WV\, 26554\, United States
description:
Feel the lavender haze creepin’ up on us! Go to Stone House Lavender to pick your own bundles\, have a picnic and enjoy the lavender. Opening day is Sunday\, June 8. Sunday from 12-5 p.m. Upick cost is $5 per person and $5 per bundle. 
Season days/times: 
12-5 p.m. Sundays 
5-7 p.m. Tuesday and Thursdays

title: Native American Appreciation Day
location: Marion County Historical Society\, 211 Adams St\, Fairmont\, WV 26554\, USA\, Fairmont\, United States

title: Intro to Spinning for Adults
location: Prickett’s Fort State Park
description: How would you like to try your hand at spinning wool? Participants will receive one hour of personal one-on-one instruction from one of our skilled interpreters. One-hour sessions are $20 per person and participants must be age 16 and older. One person per session. Please register by contacting the Foundation Office at 304-363-3030 to set up a date and time. Admission to the fort is included. Spaces fill up fast\, so make sure to register early.

title: White Hall Farmers Market
location: White Hall Public Safety Building\, 118 Tygart Mall Loop\, Whitehall\, West Virginia\, 26554
description: The 2025 White Hall Farmers & Artisans Market will have fresh produce\, products and music! The Market will take place every 2nd and 4th Saturday of the month from May 24th through September 26th.  \nBrowse 30-40 vendors at every Market\, with a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables\, grass-fed beef\, eggs\, local honey\, fresh cut flowers\, baked goods\, hand-made items\, food trucks\, coffee trucks and more.

title: Native American Appreciation Day
location: Marion County Historical Society\, 211 Adams St\, Fairmont\, WV 26554\, USA\, Fairmont\, United States

title: Battle on the Hill
location: East Fairmont High School\, 1993 Airport Road\, Fairmont\, WV\, United States
description: Come to a live-action karate event! The 26th Annual Battle on the Hill is presented by local school\, Mushin Do Karate. \n  \n*Donations accepted.

title: Live Music @ Sagebrush Round-Up
location: Sagebrush Round Up\, 2580 Bunner Ridge Rd.\, Fairmont\, WV\, 26554\, United States
description:
Sagebrush Round-Up hosts a weekly country music show and houses the Country Music Hall of Fame for West Virginia. 
Come early and try a home-cooked dinner. Be sure to snap a selfie in front of our large acoustic guitar! 
Doors open at 4 pm; dinners available at 5 pm; music begins at 6 pm 
Sagebrush Round-Up – located on Bunner Ridge near Fairmont – just six miles east of I-79\, is a tobacco and alcohol-free facility 
$8 / adult; $3 / 6 – 12

title: Palatine Park Summer Concerts
location: Palatine Park\, Palatine Park\, Everest Dr\, Fairmont\, WV 26554\, USA\, Fairmont\, United States
description:
Enjoy another summer of free concerts down by the water! 


Three Rivers Festival – 7 p.m.\, Friday\, May 23 – Get Poison’d: Tribute to Poison (headliner). Opener TBA


Three Rivers Festival – 7 p.m.\, Saturday\, May 24 – The Ultimate Doors: Tribute to The Doors (headliner). Opener TBA


Summer Concert – 7 p.m. Saturday\, June 7 – Weary Space Wanderer (opener) with Bennie And The Jets: Elton John Tribute (headliner)


Summer Concert – 7 p.m.\, Saturday\, June 14 – Eyes of the Nile: Iron Maiden Tribute (opener) and The Four Horsemen: A Celebration of Metallica (headliner)


Summer Concert – 7 p.m.\, Saturday\, June 28 – Yam Yam (opener) and Moon Hooch (headliner)


Independence Day Celebration – 6 p.m.\, Saturday\, July 5 – Host Byron “Six Six” Cooper (host and opener) with Motorcycle Drive-By (middle band) and Liquid A (headliner)


Johnnie Johnson Festival – 6 p.m.\, Saturday\, July 12 – Flight Six- Six (opener)\, The Up And Up (middle band) and The Deep Fried Five (headliner)


Summer Concert – 7 p.m.\, Saturday\, July 26 – Bluffett: Tribute to Jimmy Buffett (only band)


Summer Concert – 7 p.m.\, Saturday\, August 9 – Invincible: The Premier Pat Benatar Tribute (opener) and Adrenalize: The Ultimate Def Leppard Experience (headliner)



Summer Concert – 7 p.m.\, Saturday\, August 23 – Dre Day: An all ages Celebration of The Legendary Dr. Dre

title: Mannington Farmers & Artisan Market
location: Wintergarden Park\, corner of Water and Market Streets\, Mannington\, WV\, 26582
description: The Women’s Club of Mannington is sponsoring a weekly farmer and artisan market in downtown. \nSome of the vendors you might see include Stahl Farm\, Maa MIlk Farm\, Baskets by Geo\, Collective Energy with Mindi\, BerTeas\, Mountaineer Florist and Cummings Vegetable Stand. \n

title: Tomato Festival
location: Monroe Street\, Fairmont\, WV 26554\, USA\, Fairmont\, United States
description:
2025 Hometown Market and Tomato Festival 



Get ready for another exciting summer of Hometown Markets filled with local vendors\, live entertainment and community fun – and tomatoes!



 August 16th – Annual Tomato Festival
 September 20th – End of Summer Bash



Be on the lookout in the months to come for more details.

title: Colonial Hearth Cooking Demo
location: Prickett’s Fort State Park
description:
Come out and tour the fort and smell the food cooking over an open hearth\, the way food was prepared during the colonial period of our history. Recipes will be available upon request. Regular admission applies. 
  
Admission: $8 adults\, $6 seniors (60 and up)\, $4 children 6-12\, 5 and under free 
Pricketts Fort Memorial Foundation Members receive free admission and a 10% discount on classes and workshops.

title: Wild Turkey Trail Runs
location: Valley Falls State Park\, Valley Falls State Park\, 720 Valley Falls Rd\, Fairmont\, WV 26554\, USA\, Fairmont\, United States
description: West Virginia Mountain Trail Runners will host a Fun Run at the beautiful Valley Falls State Park. This is a free event. Food and drinks are provided\, but bring some of your own fuel as well.  The aid station is under a large park shelter right next to the parking area so you can also use your car as an aid station. We have some free giveaways for finishers (car stickers and fun homemade medals). Select your own distance to run including 50k\, Marathon\, 25k\, Half Marathon\, 10 Miler\, 8 Miler\, 5k\, and 1 mile. Members and non-members are welcome! \nRegister here: https://ultrasignup.com/register.aspx?did=118589 \nThere is an e-signed waiver and emergency information available.
